title: Establish cloud infrastructure as code
description: As a DevOps Engineer, I want to define and provision all cloud infrastructure using Terraform, so that we have a repeatable, version-controlled, and automated environment setup.
business_value: Ensures consistent and auditable infrastructure across all environments (dev, staging, prod), reduces manual configuration errors, and enables automated disaster recovery. This is a foundational enabler for the entire application.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Provision the complete AWS environment","given":"I have valid AWS credentials and an empty AWS account","when":"I run `terraform apply` on the production workspace","then":"A new VPC, ECS Cluster, Multi-AZ RDS instance, Cognito User Pool, Lambda function, and API Gateway are successfully provisioned and configured without errors."},{"scenario":"Verify environment isolation using workspaces","given":"The Terraform project is initialized","when":"I switch between the `dev`, `staging`, and `prod` workspaces","then":"Terraform correctly uses the separate state files and configuration variables for each environment, ensuring they are isolated."}]
definition_of_done: ["All infrastructure defined in Terraform code and successfully applied to a staging environment.","Terraform code is modular and peer-reviewed.","Secrets are managed via AWS Secrets Manager, not in code.","Infrastructure configuration matches the requirements specified in the SRS (e.g., REQ-1-044, REQ-1-046)."]

title: Automate build, test, and deployment with a CI/CD pipeline
description: As a Developer, I want a fully automated CI/CD pipeline in GitHub Actions, so that I can get fast feedback on my code changes, ensure quality and security standards are met, and deploy to production safely with zero downtime.
business_value: Increases development velocity, improves code quality by catching issues early, enhances security through automated scanning, and enables reliable, repeatable deployments with minimal risk.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"CI pipeline runs on code push and enforces quality gates","given":"A developer pushes a code change to a feature branch","when":"The GitHub Actions CI workflow is triggered","then":"The pipeline automatically runs linting, unit tests, integration tests, and security scans, and the build fails if any step does not meet the defined quality standards (e.g., >85% test coverage, no critical vulnerabilities)."},{"scenario":"CD pipeline deploys to production using Blue/Green strategy","given":"A new version of the application has passed all CI checks and is ready for release","when":"A developer merges the change to the main branch and triggers the CD workflow","then":"The pipeline builds the Docker image, runs database migrations, deploys the new version to a 'Green' environment, and waits for manual approval before switching production traffic."}]
definition_of_done: ["GitHub Actions workflows for CI and CD are implemented and functional.","CI pipeline correctly blocks builds that fail tests or security scans.","CD pipeline successfully deploys to AWS ECS using a Blue/Green strategy.","All secrets are managed via GitHub Encrypted Secrets, not stored in workflow files."]

title: Perform basic arithmetic operations
description: As a General User, I want to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using a clear interface, so that I can accurately and efficiently solve basic mathematical problems.
business_value: Establishes the core, non-negotiable functionality of the calculator, serving as the foundation for all other features and providing the primary value proposition to the user.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Correct Order of Operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS)","given":"The user has entered the expression '5+3×2'","when":"The user triggers the calculation (e.g., presses the '=' button)","then":"The result '11' is clearly displayed, correctly performing multiplication before addition."},{"scenario":"Division by Zero","given":"The user has entered the expression '8÷0'","when":"The user triggers the calculation","then":"A clear, non-destructive error message (e.g., 'Cannot divide by zero') is displayed, and the original input '8÷0' is preserved."}]
definition_of_done: ["Unit tests for the calculation logic achieve >90% code coverage.","Component tests for the calculator UI interactions are implemented and passing.","User interface is fully responsive and passes WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility audit.","Performance requirement of <50ms for UI updates is verified."]

title: View a history of previous calculations
description: As a user (both anonymous and registered), I want to see a scrollable list of my recent calculations and their results so that I can review my work.
business_value: Improves core usability by allowing users to reference past work, reducing errors and redundant effort.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Adding a new calculation to the history","given":"A user has the calculator open","when":"The user successfully performs a calculation (e.g., '2+2' which results in '4')","then":"A new entry appears at the top of the history list, displaying both the expression ('2+2') and the result ('4')."},{"scenario":"History panel becomes scrollable when content overflows","given":"A user has performed enough calculations to fill the visible area of the history panel","when":"The user performs another calculation","then":"The history panel displays a vertical scrollbar, and the user can scroll to view all previous entries."}]
definition_of_done: ["The history panel and its contents pass WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility checks.","UI updates to the history list complete in under 50ms.","The history panel correctly handles empty, populated, and error states."]

title: Calculate Ohm's Law and Power values
description: As an electronics practitioner, I want to enter any two known values for Voltage, Current, Resistance, or Power, so that the calculator automatically computes the remaining two values.
business_value: Provides a core, high-utility feature for the target electronics audience, increasing the application's value proposition and user engagement by simplifying a common and critical calculation.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Calculate Resistance and Power from Voltage and Current","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode and all fields are empty","when":"The user enters a valid Voltage (e.g., '12V') and a valid Current (e.g., '500mA')","then":"The Resistance field is automatically calculated and populated with the correct value (e.g., '24Ω') AND the Power field is automatically calculated and populated with the correct value (e.g., '6W')."},{"scenario":"Insufficient input for calculation","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode","when":"The user has entered a value in only one field (e.g., Voltage)","then":"The other three fields remain empty and a message is displayed prompting for more information (e.g., 'Enter any two values to calculate.')."}]
definition_of_done: ["All 6 happy-path calculation combinations are verified.","UI provides clear guidance when fewer than two inputs are present.","All calculations and UI updates complete in under 50ms.","The feature is fully accessible per WCAG 2.1 AA."]

title: Create a new custom calculation mode
description: As a registered user with specialized calculation needs, I want to start a guided, step-by-step process (a wizard) to create a new custom calculation mode, beginning with defining its unique name and description.
business_value: Enables the core user-extensible functionality of the application, increasing user engagement and retention by allowing users to create personalized tools.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Initiate wizard and complete the first step successfully","given":"I am a logged-in user and click the 'Create New Mode' button","when":"I enter a unique name and an optional description and click 'Next'","then":"The system validates the inputs successfully and I am taken to the next step of the wizard ('Define Variables')."},{"scenario":"Attempt to create a mode with a non-unique name","given":"I am a logged-in user who already has a mode named 'MyMode'","when":"I start creating a new mode and enter 'MyMode' into the 'Name' field","then":"I see an inline error message stating 'A mode with this name already exists.' and I am prevented from proceeding."}]
definition_of_done: ["Wizard component framework is implemented and state is managed correctly across steps.","API endpoint for creating the initial mode draft is implemented and secured.","UI is responsive and passes WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility checks."]

title: Register for a new user account
description: As a prospective user, I want to create a secure personal account using my email address and a strong password, while also accepting the terms of service, so that I can save my data.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which is a primary driver for user retention and engagement.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful registration with valid credentials","given":"I am an unauthenticated user on the registration page","when":"I enter a valid, unique email, a password that meets the security policy, confirm the password, accept the ToS, and click 'Register'","then":"My account is successfully created, I am automatically logged in, and I am redirected to the main calculator view."},{"scenario":"Registration attempt with a weak password","given":"I am on the registration page","when":"I enter a password that does not meet the system's security policy (12 chars, mixed types)","then":"The form submission is rejected, and an informative error message is displayed detailing the password requirements."}]
definition_of_done: ["Registration form is fully functional and accessible.","Integration with AWS Cognito is complete and uses the PKCE flow.","Backend password policy in Cognito is correctly configured via Terraform.","E2E tests for registration success and all major failure cases are passing."]

title: Log in to an existing user account
description: As a returning user with an existing account, I want to securely log in using my email and password, so that I can access my saved calculation history, variables, and custom modes.
business_value: Serves as the gateway to all personalized features, which is critical for user retention and delivering the core value of a persistent, multi-device tool.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful login with valid credentials","given":"A registered user is on the login page","when":"The user enters their correct email and password and clicks the 'Log In' button","then":"The system authenticates the user successfully, a secure session is established, and the user's persisted data is fetched and loaded into the application state."},{"scenario":"Login attempt with incorrect password","given":"A registered user is on the login page","when":"The user enters their correct email but an incorrect password","then":"A clear, non-specific error message such as 'Invalid email or password' is displayed to prevent user enumeration."}]
definition_of_done: ["Login form is fully functional and accessible.","OAuth 2.0 Auth Code flow with PKCE is correctly implemented.","Post-login data fetching for history, variables, and modes is successful.","Secure token management (in-memory storage, refresh logic) is implemented."]

title: Operate Core Scientific Calculator Functions While Offline
description: As a user, I want the core scientific calculator functions to remain fully operational after the initial application load, even if my internet connection is lost, so that my workflow is not interrupted.
business_value: Increases application reliability and user trust by providing an uninterrupted core experience, similar to a native application.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Application can be reloaded offline after initial visit","given":"The user has visited the application at least once before","when":"The user closes the browser tab, goes offline, and then re-navigates to the application URL","then":"The application loads successfully from the local cache and is fully functional for core calculations."},{"scenario":"Core calculation functions operate correctly offline","given":"The application is running in offline mode","when":"The user enters an expression using standard arithmetic, trigonometric, and scientific functions","then":"The calculator correctly computes and displays the result of the expression."}]
definition_of_done: ["A service worker is implemented and correctly caches the application shell.","A robust cache-busting strategy is in place for new deployments.","E2E tests that simulate offline conditions are implemented and passing.","Core calculator functionality is verified to be 100% operational offline."]

title: Automatically sync offline data upon reconnection
description: As a registered user, I want the application to automatically save any data changes I make while offline and sync them to my account when I reconnect, so that I can work with confidence, knowing my data is safe.
business_value: Increases user trust, data integrity, and application reliability. Reduces user friction and potential data loss, enhancing the professional quality of the product.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Sync new calculation history created while offline","given":"I am a logged-in user and my device loses its internet connection","when":"I perform a new calculation and then my device reconnects to the internet","then":"The application automatically initiates a sync process, and the new history item is successfully saved to my account on the backend."},{"scenario":"Conflict resolution for variable update using last-write-wins","given":"My variable 'gamma' has a value of 100. On Device A (online), I update it to 110. On Device B (offline), I update it to 90.","when":"Device B reconnects to the internet","then":"The system resolves the conflict using the 'last-write-wins' strategy, where the server's version (110) is authoritative, and Device B's UI updates to show 110."}]
definition_of_done: ["Offline data modifications are successfully queued in IndexedDB.","Upon reconnection, the queue is processed and data is sent to the backend.","Conflict resolution logic for both append-only and mutable data is implemented and tested.","E2E tests that simulate offline/online transitions are passing."]

title: Ensure a seamless and functional user experience across all device sizes
description: As any user, I want the application's interface to adapt seamlessly to my device's screen size, so that I can have a productive and frustration-free experience on mobile, tablet, or desktop.
business_value: Increases user reach, satisfaction, and retention by providing a consistent, high-quality experience on any device.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Application layout on a mobile device","given":"A user accesses the application on a device with a viewport width less than 768px","when":"The application loads any page or view","then":"The layout must render in a single-column format, the primary navigation must be collapsed into a 'hamburger' menu, and no primary content requires horizontal scrolling."},{"scenario":"Application layout on a desktop device","given":"A user accesses the application on a device with a viewport width greater than 1024px","when":"The application loads any page or view","then":"The layout must effectively utilize the available horizontal space, and the primary navigation must be fully expanded and visible."}]
definition_of_done: ["Layout is verified and functional at key breakpoints (375px, 768px, 1280px).","E2E tests for core user flows pass on both mobile and desktop viewports.","WCAG 2.1 accessibility requirements for reflow and tap target size are met."]
